intro: Onychium carnosum, commonly known as the woolly onychium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
